Dear GENU,

I have to admit I really liked how you changed from spoken to singing ! 
Although "Come Closer" is a unique track (in a really nice way), I felt a few things could have been a bit different; if I may :

a) I would have really like for a more controlled low end. Also, maybe cutting also the highs of the bass could have made more space for the guitar body !
b) I would have also really liked for a bit of more chords progressions, as they sound felt a bit repetitive after a while.
c) Moreover, I would have really liked parts to come in go (i.e. 2nd verse if only the bass was present) !

Not a bad track at all, but I felt production and arrangement wise it could have been a bit better.

I'm really sorry I will have to pass on "Come Closer" for now.
Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success with this one !

Dear R-IK,

Although "Desole" is a very solid production, I felt a few things could have been different; if I may :

b) I was not a big fan of the guitar and bass pad being panned so much to the left. I would have gone for a more balanced Left-Right mix.

Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success in 2021 !

Please note that comment is my professional opinion as a music producer and audio engineer. Nothing is personal, but only direct advice and thoughts of the song's possible improvement. Also comments on what is better about the song, and also what could be better yet.

Hi¬† MADSUN :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting Discovery to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for¬† "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB¬†
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt¬†

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to Discovery and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
¬†
There's heaps we love about this track. Sound design is top notch; the little stereo-ping-ponged bells in the breakdown. The tasteful sub bass underscoring the pads. The vibrant percussion keeping the groove throughout the builds. The emotive strings, and the mid-tempo heavily sidechained kick-snare beat of the "drop". The dancing octave strings.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, unfortunately the main thing this missed to be a Futurepop track was enough vocal. It was quite minimal on lyrics, with no verse/chorus vocal to hold it to the pop category. As such, it's more of an electronic track, not a pop track and therefore not an appropriate match. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on electronic music more broadly, though.

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Ciao e grazie della richiesta feedback. Il brano √® piacevole melodicamente, la produzione cosi e cosi. Lo condivideremo sulla nostra pagina FB

Ciao Edoardo,

ti parla Guido, del reparto A&R di Grifo Dischi.
Ho ascoltato il tuo brano. Ad un primo ascolto ho apprezzato la spontaneit√† e la naturalezza della voce, che presenta dei tratti caratterizzanti e delle scelte stilistiche interessanti. Peccato, forse, per l'eccessivo utilizzo di "bad words", che allontanano l'ascoltatore dalla dimensione intima del brano. Capisco la ricerca di un tipo di cantato quasi "parlato", ma una scelta del genere dovrebbe arricchire la composizione, piuttosto che rischiare di sminuirla o impoverirla.

Per quello che concerne la produzione, ho delle riserve sul balance del mix (la voce esce molto fuori rispetto al resto, che passa quasi in secondo piano, non riuscendo cos√¨ a conferire un corretto sviluppo dinamico); ed in particolare sul suono del pianoforte, un po' troppo cheap. 

Detto questo, qualora potesse interessarti, attualmente Grifo Dischi √® attiva anche come agenzia. In questa veste, ci occupiamo di seguire progetti che comunque riteniamo interessanti, al fine di accompagnarli nel loro percorso artistico e di fornirgli tutti i mezzi necessari per uscire sul mercato discografico attuale in maniera ponderata ed efficace. L'etichetta √® in grado di coprire tutti quegli aspetti che ritengo indispensabili per un progetto: dalla direzione artistica al master, dal management alla distribuzione; sfruttando le nostre competenze professionali ed il nostro consolidato network di collaboratori e professionisti addetti ai lavori, siamo in grado di garantire ai progetti con cui collaboriamo dei risultati sensibili.

Vedo che sei gi√† uscito con questo lavoro, ma nel caso in cui avessi altro materiale, potresti contattarci per avere ulteriori delucidazioni in tal senso. 

Per il momento ti auguro un grande in bocca al lupo.
A presto,

G.
Cos√¨ delicato e strappa anima da confonderci piacevolmente. Degno di nota √® ovviamente il titolo, non potevi trovare di meglio. Continua cos√¨!

Hi!

"Step in the Arena" is a good track, it combines elements of rock, alternative metal, hip hop and electronic music, and it also has some interesting vocals added to this very eclectic instrumental.

I've listened to the song a few times and to my ears it sounds like a very confusing mix of various distinct elements that didn't really work out together. As we've seen before, with Linkin Park and other acts that blended electronic elements with hip hop and alternative metal, it can be done, it's not impossible but it's not an easy trick to pull off. Unfortunately, all the elements used in your track are absolutely great on their own, but when put together, they lose their impact almost entirely. It's like a bunch of non-related tracks laid onto another without much thought given to it.

Thanks for sending the track, be safe and keep on!

LA-based rock band, Love Ghost announces a 4-song EP dropping February 5th

Love Ghost is an indie/alternative/hard rock band consisting of Finnegan Bell (guitar and vocals), Daniel Alcala (Guitar), Ryan Stevens (Bass and background vocals) Samson Young (drums and background vocals) and Cory Batchler (keyboards).
Their new EP 'Sabertoothed' is the work of the band  and producer Danny Saber (Rolling Stones, Marilyn Manson, David Bowie). The songs, written pre-pandemic, mix Emo feels, and guitar-driven alternative rock.
"Step In The Arena"  is about standing up for yourself when people try to tear you down.

Considero a faixa regular, est√° tudo lugar, mas ela n√£o marca. Me soa muito comum, apesar de alguns acertos. Sinto que falta de mais for√ßa. Um refr√£o mais marcante, um arranjo mais ousado, uma altern√¢ncia no riff, enfim. H√° um caminho interessante para se trilhar. As interfer√™ncias que surgem em meio √† faixa s√£o bons, mas no todo √© repetitivo. 

I consider the track regular, everything is in place, but it doesn't score. It sounds very common to me, despite some successes. I feel a lack of strength. A more striking chorus, a more daring arrangement, an alternation in the riff, in short. There is an interesting path to take. The interferences that appear in the middle of the track are good, but on the whole it is repetitive.

I confess that at the beginning it sounded quite strange, many electronic elements that led to Nu Metal, and vocal did not please much at first but it gradually became interesting, the thing is to always be open to knowing new sounds, it is a risky bet to invest in the mixture of electro with rock even though it is not something new, and in my humble opinion a vocal without effects would have more impact, because the music in general is very good!

J'avoue qu'au d√©but √ßa sonnait tr√®s √©trange, beaucoup d'√©l√©ments √©lectroniques qui ont conduit √† Nu Metal, et la voix ne plaisait pas beaucoup au d√©but mais c'est devenu progressivement int√©ressant, l'important est d'√™tre toujours ouvert pour conna√Ætre de nouveaux sons, c'est un risque de miser sur le m√©lange de l'√©lectro avec du rock m√™me si ce n'est pas nouveau, et √† mon humble avis une voix sans effets aurait plus d'impact, car la musique en g√©n√©ral est tr√®s bonne!

Confesso que no come√ßo soava bem estranho, muitos elementos eletr√¥nicos que levaram ao Nu Metal, e o vocal n√£o agradou muito no come√ßo mas aos poucos foi ficando interessante, o importante √© estar sempre aberto para conhecer novos sons, √© um risco apostar na mistura do electro com o rock mesmo que n√£o seja uma novidade, e na minha humilde opini√£o um vocal sem efeitos teria mais impacto, porque a m√∫sica em geral √© muito boa!

We would say the production quality is 9/10, the instrumentals are fire, the harmony is pleasing, but we think you could've use reduced the use of autotunes in it.

The lyrics don't really say anything to us, it is not relatable, and of course, to be relatable is not a rule to be followed in the music universe, people sing about the most unusual things we all can imagine, but the problem here is that we also didn't get involved by what you're suggesting in "Step In The Arena" specifically. It is so metaphoric that makes it really hard to be touched by it.

The idea for a lyric video is nice, but it is hard to read the inicial and last word of each line because they kind of blend with the dark background.

At 3:28 minutes there's also this editing problem with the lyrics on top of each other, we cant read what's written.

We know it's hard to listen some negative feedback over something we really care, but here we must be sincere to our experience as listeners of the songs that come for us, we hope you understand and don't be mad.

A simply uplifting track!

Ho ascoltato con attenzione.
Allora, partiamo dall'inizio. Questo √® un genere che oggi non va, e quindi per riuscire ad ottenere attenzione, bisogna o rivolgersi ad un target ben definito, oppure cercare di mescolarlo con un vestito che abbia una forma adattabile ai nostri tempi.
L'arrangiamento √® molto classic, e riprende molto la modalit√† con cui tra fine '80 e primi '90 si riprende il prog e il rock degli anni '70. E alla fine, se il genere √® quello, poco si pu√≤ fare. Cercherei di essere pi√π esplosivo nelle aperture dei ritornelli, di utilizzare delle sonorit√† per la batteria, in fase di mixaggio, meno italiane, ma pi√π internazionali. Il finale, in particolare, non esplode. Il cantante dovrebbe essere pi√π esplosivo e invece mi rimane a met√† strada. Il tutto, comunque, considerando l'ottima capacit√† musicale evidente dei singoli musicisti, rimane un peccato. 
Infine, dato che il genere √® quello, non dei nostri tempi, ma giustamente lo stile va lasciato tale, si dovrebbe intervenire sui testi, che anche questi sono troppo retrospettivi. Oggi il testo deve essere immaginifico: creare immagini solo mediante le parole. Qui manca, e su quello secondo me si pu√≤ cercare di intervenire in maniera energica, ottenendo ottimi risultati.

Ci piace molto il concetto "less is more" adottato, che valorizza all'ennesima potenza la tua voce. Produrre un brano del genere, che non stanca e risulta interessante per tutta la sua durata, nonostante la ritmica quasi assente, √® molto complicato.
Per quanto in realt√† ci siano elementi melodici, seppur molto rarefatti e il brano sia in linea con produzioni moderne di alto livello, a nostro gusto, sentiamo l'assenza di un'apertura, anche minima, anche breve, che potrebbe valorizzare ulteriormente il brano.
Il mix suona bene, le basse sono giuste e gli effetti sulla voce sono efficaci e ben distribuiti.
Il tuo brano, complessivamente, ci √® piaciuto molto ma, come si dice, "ti manca 1 per fare 31".
Ci piacerebbe ascoltare qualcos'altro del tuo progetto...
In bocca al lupo!

ti parla Alessio, direttore artistico di Grifo Dischi.
Devo dire che, ad un primo ascolto, ho apprezzato la dimensione sonora, a mio avviso molto intima e spontanea anche  grazie ad alcune scelte di arrangiamento. Rimango molto perplesso sul suono della chitarra solista, il fuzz lo rende sgraziato, a mio avviso, e  "scollato" dal contesto. Un altro dubbio riguarda la parte di batteria, che sicuramente si lega perfettamente con l'approccio ritmico della voce; ma che, al contempo, necessiterebbe di una costruzione migliore, magari attraverso l'inserimento del charleston quantomeno nella seconda strofa. Questo aiuterebbe sia a dare movimento alla parte ritmica sia a garantire maggiore dinamica.

Il brano, considerato tutto, lo trovo buono, acerbo, ma con diversi spunti. La produzione non la trovo al top. Sicuramente, le scelte sono state pensate e dosate, ma rimango dell'idea che con un altro approccio e lavoro di produzione potevamo ascoltare una vera Hit... a parere mio.
Morale, hai tutte le carte in regola per un lancio nel panorama indipendete e non solo... la sostanza c'√®, bisogna dargli una forma.
Rimaniamo in contatto.

Ciao Zerosei,
ti ringraziamo per aver condiviso con noi la tua musica. Purtroppo il motivo di questa traccia √® simile ad un'altra pi√π famosa.

Grazie mille e buona musica

Ciao Domiziano, √® un vero piacere fare la tua conoscenza e salire sul tuo ‚ÄúSommergibile‚Äù.
Il brano non brilla per originalit√†, √® vero, gira su accordi classicissimi e ovviamente si butta in una mischia dove la concorrenza √® numerosa e spietata (forse di peggio c‚Äô√® solo la trap‚Ä¶). L‚Äôindie pop da cameretta, ottima definizione devo dire, si sente tutto. Il testo √® quello che fa la differenza; ok, non √® Dostoevskij o Quasimodo ma a una canzone pop si chiede immediatezza, freschezza e idee originali ben espresse.
Le parole non devono sembrare scritte con il vocabolario messo accanto, bisogna trasmettere spontaneit√† e invogliare all'ascolto scorrendo in modo naturale, senza forzature e inciampi.
In Sommergibile tutto questo c‚Äô√®; in pi√π si sentono tutti i tuoi diciannove anni, sia nell'entusiasmo, nella fragranza della giovent√π che ‚Äì naturalmente ‚Äì nella inesperienza.
La metrica √® rivedibile a tratti, la dinamica della voce √® incostante e la dizione andrebbe curata con pi√π attenzione; metti spesso l‚Äôaccento sulla seconda sillaba e ti mangi la parte finale della parola (ah, questi romani!).
Il brano strutturalmente non √® affatto male, potrebbe essere leggermente accorciato senza che si senta la mancanza di nulla visto che negli ultimi 40 secondi si pasticcia un po‚Äô.
Non specifichi se lo hai registrato in casa o meno ma spero di s√¨, dato che i suoni e il mix purtroppo sono di livello molto basso. La voce √® sparatissima a tratti e il suono degli strumenti andrebbe curato molto di pi√π. La musica da cameretta deve essere una attitudine artistica, va bene un suono scarno e lo-fi ma deve essere sempre voluto e curato.
Mi piacerebbe farti delle domande e darti qualche consiglio, visto che sono sicuro che sei molto ricettivo su questi argomenti. Sei sicuro che sia una buona idea uscire con un brano sui social senza avere ancora costruito un minimo di fan base? E non credi che esordire con un prodotto di qualit√† ti aiuterebbe ad acquisirne una con maggiore facilit√†?
Ecco, se andiamo a vedere come si muovono gli Artisti giovanissimi che fanno numeri (indipendentemente dal genere) ci accorgiamo che il loro ingresso sulle piattaforme avviene quando in un modo o nell‚Äôaltro sono gi√† riusciti ad avere un bel seguito su Youtube e Instagram (di Facebook agli inizi se ne pu√≤ fare a meno, √® pi√π da ‚Äúvecchi‚Äù). Capisco benissimo comunque la tua voglia di metterti in gioco e avere un minimo di riscontro. Solo chi non fa niente non sbaglia mai, quindi meglio fare!
Adesso devi rimboccarti le maniche e metterti al lavoro sui social!
Ti auguro un enorme in bocca al lupo e ti faccio i miei complimenti; la stoffa c‚Äô√®, ora bisogna studiare!

It's so nice when some tracks begin in a way and take unexpected paths as they develop. When the first notes of the acoustic guitar sounded, I thought it would take a different direction ‚Äî and I was pleasantly surprised with how it went, especially when the drums arrived. It's worth mentioning that the percussion here made all the difference, as it did a good job holding everything together and bringing some fast-paced rhythm to a subtle song, in a coherent way.

Some of the genres you brought on the description are pretty apparent, but some others might not be that much, and that's actually a good thing in my opinion. Personally, I enjoy it very much when the listener gradually starts discovering some references as I listen to the track. For example, there is definitely a rock vibe in the mood of the song, and there is one moment where it becomes most clear. At 1:48 minute, when there is only the acoustic guitar and subsequently the vocals, is a really good example of some formats used on some very famous rock hits. And, this one specifically reminded me so much of the song "Drive" from Incubus. Not to compare here, but not think of them was almost impossible.

Overall it's a really enjoyable song that many people with different music tastes might enjoy. It's well-produced, well equalized and the volumes of the instrument seem well balanced as well. We are adding this to our playlist on Spotify! Cheers from Brazil and keep going!

Hello Magon!

Thanks so much for requesting us to review your track. Really enjoying the sort of spoken word delivery you've got going on here. While the instrumentation does its own thing in the background, mainly the bass line, the story you're telling over it is really nice. We really liked how you'd sort of switch off from singing and speaking. It made for a nice and diverse track that sounds way different from all others. Congrats on this release! Great music video as well.

Additionally, we'd love to check you out on Instagram if you have one. Feel free to follow us at ours: @wewriteaboutmusic

Take care!

First of all, it's hard not to get mesmerized by this fantastic animation. It got me right from the start, it flows so elegantly, the style is so unique, everything seems to be right where it should. Now, sound-wise: I could really feel all the references you brought on the description, but it also reminded me of some other artists like "The Whitest Boy Alive", especially when we are analyzing the timbre of the guitar and the drums. Also, the vocals also brought me to the sound of "Mellow Days" and maybe "Vacations".

The instrumentation is simple but so powerful at the same time, subtle but very incisive as well. This is a very creative way to make the track engaging and catchy for the listener ‚Äì well, at least it worked pretty well for me. The backing vocals also play a crucial role in this feeling of uniqueness: as the main voice keeps on this "reciting" style of singing, the backing vocals are in a very different place, but in a coherent and complementary manner. 

Personally, I enjoyed this track very much, the technical aspects seem to be very well resolved, the equalization is sharp and it's possible to discern all the colors on it. Overall it's truly well-produced and your artistic identity is apparent and cohesive, hence everything is connected and makes sense as a whole.

You definitely got a new fan from Brazil and we are gladly adding this track to our playlist on Spotify! Congrats on your work and keep going! Cheers.
Thanks for sending! I apologize for the English feedback. I liked this track a lot, and am happy to add it to a Spotify playlist. Link coming shortly. Cheers!

Ciao Nico Kyni! Innanzitutto grazie per averci contattato!
Abbiamo ascoltato la tua "Qui Con Me", un brano new-urban con sonorit√† "black" e forti influenze funk.
I suoni scelti sono ricercati, caratteristici del genere, moderni soprattutto per come sono scritte le parti eseguite.
Ritmica energica, groove coinvolgente, elementi melodici belli, ben arrangiati, danno vita ad una produzione √® di altissimo livello che non ha nulla da invidiare a brani che sono nelle posizioni pi√π alte nelle charts.
Tu sei molto bravo, canti bene e sei intonato, hai un bel timbro, notevole estensione vocale, ottima padronanza della dinamica. Abbiamo apprezzato molto anche la tua capacit√† di interpretazione del testo, con la quale aggiungi ulteriore freschezza al brano gi√† molto fresh.
Per certi aspetti, sei un mix tra Justin Timberlake, Michael Jackson e Bruno Mars... insomma una bomba! Bravo!
Il testo √® semplice, ma di quella semplicit√† efficace, che non stanca, che entra in testa e che il pubblico canta da subito, ma soprattutto che fa ballare.
Il mix suona bene, ma √® ulteriormente migliorabile. Il balance √® giusto, ma alcuni elementi sonori a volte sono poco a fuoco ed √® un peccato, perch√® potrebbero dare ancora pi√π energia al pezzo.
Ci farebbe molto piacere ascoltare altri brani tuoi, per farci un'idea pi√π completa del tuo percorso artistico..
In bocca al lupo!

Hi¬†Panaviscope :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting TLSPoE to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for¬† "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B."
Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB¬†
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt¬†

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to TLSPoE and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
¬†
That bassline that kicks in prior to the first minute, really reminded us of Royksopp. It's phatt and punchy, both organic feeling and synthetic feeling at the same time. Also a bit of a Daft Punk vibe. It's the one sound amongst that sea of beautiful production detail that we felt grounded the track together most strongly. The switch-up to half-time beat before the 2nd minute, was fresh and effective. Following with a breakdown deflated the energy a little too soon for us but it was still an exceptionally polished track throughout. The rest of the track dances with disco-pop synth-pop vibes and a little dream pop as well. Fantastic use of genreblending.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, the main two issues we had with this one was that it was much too long. Over 7 minutes for a single?? Very bold decision, but the risk means we can't add you to our playlist. Secondly we felt that vocally, there wasn't much of a strong pop topline. It had more of an introspective, stream of consciousness type of alternative RnB vibe without much of an "earworm" refrain. Besides this, the track was absolutely fantastic, so please don't be disheartened. I'd strongly encourage you to release a punchy radio edit in future. The psychedelic edit is totally different and we couldn't use it for Futurepop either, despite it being so short. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on this, though.¬† ¬†

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Hello Panaviscope and crew! Hope you‚Äôre all doing fine and taking care. Thanks for the contact, first of all. We really appreciate your pick.
.
The Last Smart Person On Earth is a track that causes a certain strangeness at first, especially for the very experimental beginning, but throughout the track we were able to dive into a sea of very well made arrangements, with excellent synthesizer tones. It is a track that mixes alternative rock from the 90s with a more contemporary electronic style, which makes the track something very interesting to appreciate. The track has an extended duration, however it is not tiring to hear because it has several different climates that guide the listener through the music.
.
We also really like the whole visual part, from the animations to the black and white aesthetic of your social networks, this creates a whole visual universe that complements your musical work and adds layers for your listeners to dive into.
.
Lately our site is not receiving new articles, as our podcast is undergoing reformulations, but we will include your track in our series of playlists that will begin to be released in February. Hope we can talk to you soon again about further releases. Take care (:

This is the kind of track that makes you wanna get up on your feet and start moving and dancing like there is nothing else to do, and it does so right in the first seconds of the song. Some references came straight into my mind as the track developed a little, like MGMT and maybe a little bit of Justice. It's not a matter of comparison, but how it sounds, where it takes the listener and, how it makes us feel. 

The harmony of the song is very uplifting and it gets even more as it progresses. Another aspect worth mentioning here is how the song evolves in a particular and unexpected way, hence its length and all the places it reaches. The vocals also play a very crucial role here, as their high pitch contrast with the powerful beat and this really cool bassline. There are also points in the track where you chose to put clean instruments, like at 5:35 when the electric guitar goes along with the melody on the vocals and it sounds amazing.

Last but not least, the narrative behind the video is very intriguing and made me, at least, very curious and intrigued. As the story goes and the other characters are introduced, we start to realize what connects them, even though they never get to meet each other. It had an unexpected ending, but nevertheless a nice one. The style of the animation was also very pleasing and unusual for me. 

We are adding this track to our playlist on Spotify! Thanks for sharing it with us and keep going. You got a new fan from Brazil!

Hello! How are you?

First of all, thanks for contacting me!

In this modern and fast times, we are each day less used to listen to longer songs. On the other hand, I didn't feel "The Last Smart Person On Earth"'s 8 minutes duration passing slowly. 

It's a catchy song that brings elements from multiple musical sides. It's electronic, but it's indie at the same time and this is such a good feeling. In aesthetics, reminded me about a mixture between Tame Impala and a softer Skrillex.

I also took the liberty to check out your social networks, as well as your other songs. I loved your Instagram feed and I wish I have know the "Like The Sun" album before!

I'll share this track with the team of a website I write for. If we get some space, I'll let you know!

Congratulations!

Best regards,

Ciao Dami, grazie per averci inviato la tua produzione. L'intro di chitarra non √® male e  mi piace la sua combinazione con suoni ricchi di riverbero: i primi minuti sono infatti profondi e piacevoli. Non mi piace il suono che hai utilizzato tra i 2 e i 3 minuti; √® abbastanza fastidioso. Buono il cambio dopo i  3 minuti, mi ricorda alla lontana il passaggio centrale di  Windowlicker di Aphex. Mi piace molto anche il crescendo a 4 minuti: diciamo che per aver come strumento centrale la chitarra la traccia √® ben costruita, bilanciata e intelligente (e non sono un grandissimo fan della chitarra).  La traccia nel suo complesso √® molto piacevole e contiene al suo interno un tono "tragico" quasi epico, ricco di pathos che adoro. Mi √® piaciuta tutta la tua produzione, tranne il suono che ti segnalavo. La trovo bilanciata e intelligente e secondo me pu√≤ avere successo sia a livello prettamente musicale, che in un contesto di performance o installazione artistica.  Teniamoci in contatto  perch√©, se continui a crescere, potremo pensare a qualche collaborazione inserendoti nella nostra rubrica per giovani emergenti. Grazie mille.

Hello Apple Jelly! First of all, thank you for contacting us!
Your "Die, Motherfucker! Die !!!" is an electro-rock song with modern, sophisticated, energetic and engaging sounds.
Despite its duration, the track flows well, is never dull, is well produced and arranged.
The bass line is simple, but that winning simplicity, which never tires.
The synths create a disturbing sensation, with constant growth of tension.
Personally, the only sound element that has not fully convinced us is the drum: the sounds are not aggressive like the others and at the level of parts, you could have dared more.
The vocalist is good, has a nice timbre, is in tune and gives an added value to the instrumental, interpreting the text in an interesting way.
The mix sounds good, all the elements are intelligible and well distributed in the stereo landscape. To our taste, the low frequencies should be controlled a little better in some places.
The video is a bomb! Really well crafted and acted. Compliments!
Overall we liked your song and we will gladly listen to other songs to better understand your artistic path.
Good luck!

GO Staff

ho ascoltato il pezzo poi sono andato a sentirmi il resto dell'EP su Spotify. Grazie delle belle parole e del supporto che ci dimostri.

La scrittura √® matura soprattutto nei contenuti, la parte musicale convincente pero' i pezzi non si distinguono sul piano vocale. Risulti incerto in diverse parti specialmente quando provi a cantare. Ho sentito alcune acciaccature a livello metrico  e le gradisco solo quando il contenuto √® talmente superiore da mettere in secondo piano la metrica.
Finisco dicendoti che sarebbe buona cosa aggiungere una bio piu consistente, almeno et√† e provenienza poi se non ci sono elementi discografici poco importa. Pero giudicare la maturit√† o il potenziale di un artista senza sapere l'et√† √® davvero difficile.
Spero di esserti stato utile!!
Un 'abbraccio

Hi 6 Once, I listened to the piece then I went to hear the rest of the EP on Spotify. Thanks for the nice words and the support you show us.
I leave you my personal feedback on everything I have heard:
The writing is mature especially in the contents, the musical part convincing but the pieces do not stand out on the vocal level. You are uncertain in several parts especially when trying to sing. I've heard some metric-level acciaccaccades and I only like them when the content is so superior that it overshadows the metric.
I finish by telling you that it would be a good thing to add a more consistent bio, at least age and origin then if there are no record elements it does not matter. But judging an artist's maturity or potential without knowing the age is really difficult.
I hope I was helpful!!
A hug

Hi¬†Lyre le Temps  :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting Summer Leaves to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for¬† "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B."

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB¬†
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt¬†

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to Summer Leaves and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
¬†
The song is high energy indeed, with a strong percussive presence and a large amount of classic Electro Swing instrumentation: brass, piano/keys, groovey jazzy vocals. It really gets you moving and transports me to the inside of a sweaty swing/jazz club.

Ultimately, while it was enjoyable, this had a lot more in common with the past - ie: it's a retro vibe, a classic Electro Swing genre track and therefore, it cannot be classed as "the future of pop". For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on Electro Swing though.¬† ¬†

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Hello!

Hi Norah, thanks for choosing me to consider your track Wish I was Ur Guitar.

I like the title!  This reminds me of Courtney Barnett.

I think the recording here isn't doing you any favours the guitar is drowning out the vocals, the balance between the two seems well off.

The chorus is fun and catchy but the vocal range is necessarily there to pull the hook out from the verse enough I dont think.  Making that pop in some way will be all important.  Perhaps and middle 8 or bridge to build to it or incorporating other instruments maybe?

I think there is plenty of potential on display here and I'd be keen to hear what else you have in the future but not one for me today Im afraid.

All the best for 2021.

Un pezzo pop che guarda ad una scrittura particolarmente narrativa e quotidiana oltre che ad una serie di suoni che guardano coerentemente alla contemporaneit√† electropop basandosi su campionamenti sintetici. La voce calda riesce a reggere bene il peso di un brano che ha, nel testo, degli spunti interessanti e delle tematiche "fuori dal comune" nel senso positivo del termine.

Ciao Danilo! Innanzitutto grazie per averci contattato!
Abbiamo ascoltato il tuo brano, che trasmette una spensieratezza che di questi tempi √® necessaria e fa piacere trovare nelle canzoni.
Il mood, simil indie-cantautoriale √® centrato.
La strumentale....? Abbiamo fatto davvero tanta fatica a capire quali elementi la costituissero. A parte una timida ritmica, il suono che fa da rullante (altissimo di volume) sul 2 e sul 4 nel ritornello, gli elementi armonici sono presenti, ma non si sentono al punto da apprezzarli.
Tu sei bravino, non sempre intonato, ma credibile. Con qualche lezione di canto con un professionista, colmerai rapidamente le tue lacune. Interpreti molto bene il testo che hai scritto, al quale si sente che sei affezionato e che hai scritto col cuore.
Le vocali finali lunghe... NO. Terribbbili con 3 "b". Invecchiano il brano, sono noiose, ma soprattutto sono troppe. Se le usi nel ritornello, devi escluderle sulle altre parti del brano o viceversa.
Il mix √® migliorabile: La voce √® troppo "avanti" rispetto alla strumentale. In alcuni punti, sembra anche troppo compressa e "artefatta". La voce che armonizza non sempre √® precisa e crea un flam sgradevole.
Carina l'idea, simpatico il testo, la realizzazione √® un po' lacunosa.
Complessivamente quindi la tua "Pinomania" ci √® piaciuta, ma non ci ha convinti.
Sei bravo, ma hai ancora tanta strada da percorrere. Con il tempo e impegno costante, porterai sicuramente ad un livello pi√π alto i tuoi prodotti.
Se hai altro da farci ascoltare, ci piacerebbe riceverlo per farci un'idea pi√π completa sul tuo percorso artistico.

Se pu√≤ interessarti, scrivendoci una mail, puoi rivolgerti al nostro team di beatmaker, arrangiatori, mix/mastering engineer per portare i tuoi brani ad un livello pi√π alto.

In bocca al lupo!

Hello there! thank you for sending you track for feedback :)

So, my first feedback would be that you need to know better what kind of sound you are promoting. This track is totally ambient, not lo-fi chill beats at all, and I didn't feel the japanese vibe you described. Normally, japanese type of beat have some japanese instruments to it, like Koto and Shakuhachi.

The track itself is good, it's really relaxing and I like the guitar and piano details you've put on it. I only feel that the main piano chords are very repetitive. That's being said, there are three ways you can fix if you find yourself in that situation: make variations in those chords, make production decision to filter some parts/make something different or make the song shorter.

Overall, I think you have a good song and definitely you will only get better. I don't know your other songs, but promoting them in the right genre will help even more spread it to the world.

Stay safe buddy! Cheers :)

Thank you for sharing this! I dig the slow-burn, minimalist aspect of this track. I do wish the samples were richer, warmer, and had more depth. I feel the wall of sound slowing evolving and growing could have a bigger impact, especially when it starts building up at 2min. I also feel a work of the VST's expression automation could help the swells come in and out smoother. I'd also recommend using a low bass synth to double the tonic at a low octave to add a bit of rumble and fill the frequency spectrum a bit more. And finally, I think the ending could use some polishing. With that said, I can hear the potential and the arrangements and voicings carry out the emotion. Nicely done!

Hello Start your own cult, thank you for your track Brick Red Heart.

I like how the chorus explodes with crashing drums and a real uplift in all areas, many tracks find it difficult to make their hooks 'pop', you've done a great job of having no issue in that department.

Whilst the track reminds me of some bands I like such as WAAX, Black Honey, Yonaka etc, it  does have more of a footing in pop that in rock I would say.  For that reason it's not quite my style but I can't really fault the track either.

Great commercial success seems probable for the track I would say, edgy but radio friendly, Triple J will adore this if they dont already.

Not one for me on this occasion but a job well done all the same, bravo.

Dear Ralph Beaubrun,

I have to admit this is by far one of the best mastered tracks I've heard in a while. And the beat also was A+ production-wise. There were however a couple of things I would have liked differently; if I may :

a) I would have really liked for the vocals to have been a bit more upfront, especially for a song of your genre ! They were a bit too much in the back.
b) I was not a very big fan of the plucks playing all the time. I would have loved for them to come in and out of the different song parts.

I'm really really sorry I will have to pass on this gem for now.
Can't but thank you for a great submission and wish you all the success in 2021 !
Merci !

Ciao Sevaram! Innanzitutto grazie per averci contattati!
Abbiamo ascoltato "L'alchimista", un brano molto interessante, che abbiamo apprezzato!
La strumentale √® di alto livello, ricca di suoni belli, freschi, anche se non sempre modernissimi.
La ritmica, insieme alla linea melodica vocale (flow), danno al brano un tiro veramente forte, che entra in testa e coinvolge molto l'ascoltatore.
A proposito di ritmica, c'√® qualche colpo di cassa che, a nostro gusto, √® di troppo.
Il synth presente nel ritornello, sinceramente, non ci ha fatto impazzire. La parte √® scritta bene, nonostante non sia modernissima, il suono per√≤ non √® un bel suono. Unica nota dolente.
Il brano complessivamente √® ben arrangiato, ben prodotto e non ha assolutamente nulla da invidiare a tracce presenti nelle posizioni pi√π alte delle chart o in playlist ufficiali Spotify.
Tu sei molto bravo, sei intonato, hai un bel timbro e un flow pazzesco, buona padronanza della dinamica e una notevole capacit√† di interpretazione, che rende ci√≤ che canti ancora pi√π affascinante.
Il testo √® UN TESTO, cosa che, in questi tempi bui √® sempre pi√π raro trovare. Scritto bene, pieno di argomenti interessanti e particolari, riferimenti culturali e ricercati. Bravo! Davvero complimenti!
Il mix √® buono, ma a parer nostro migliorabile. Gli elementi sonori presenti sono tutti intellegibili e ben tristribuiti nel panorama stereo, ma non sempre sono ben a fuoco, al punto da essere maggiormente incisivi.
In ultimo, ma non ultimo, molto bello anche il video!
Ci piacerebbe ascoltare qualcos'altro, per farci un'idea pi√π approfondita del tuo percorso artistico..
In bocca al lupo!

Hi Alchemy 3, thank you for your track Ride us through the storm.

It reminds me of experimental acts such as Massive Attack and These New Puritans plus more folk acts such as Wye Oak.

In isolation, the vocals, guitar, percussion are all on point, I would just question when brought together if the track offers enough to really grab the listeners attention.

For those who prefer the chilled out indie vibe this may really appeal.  However for me I'm looking for something a little more memorable or catchy.  I cant criticise the track, just not on my wavelength Im afraid.

All the very best for 2021.

Poco pi√π di due minuti dove si possono apprezzare originalit√† e naturalezza, tutti ingredienti che Giovanni ha saputo inserire con sapienza e dedizione andando cos√¨ a creare un brano bello e coinvolgente.

Rio showcases all the best affinities of contemporary pop music but still notably explores the vast universe of the nineties Brit-pop rock sound. This composition grasps the best of both worlds while articulating in such a distinctive manner that vividly resembles the musicianship of the nineties pop music. I adore how the chants are layering the remaining orchestrations of the group with very precise vocal chops during the verses, but they're also leveling up by letting it louder and loose throughout the choruses. The remaining of the group showcases delicate melodies that might sound a bit minimalistic on the first listening, but there are layers of thoughtfully arranged instrumentations. Every ingredient is well-produced and perfectly matches the pop-rock ambiance without being overwhelming. Well done!

Hello Two Sevens, thank you for the track 207.

I like your voice, it has a great sense of emotive authenticity.

As soon as I saw the overall track length and how slow the song started I thought you face a challenge of creating a fully finished song in just a couple of minutes.

As it is I think the track is nice enough but perhaps lacking that hook or moment to really allow it to stand out and become memorable, as such when 2:08 rolls around it felt a little unfinished as it ends abruptly.

I would think about incorporating some kind of middle 8/bridge to give the track a proper closing.

Again though, in the absence of a chorus which will act as an ear worm I think it will be hard to stand out in a market more saturated that ever.

All the best for 2021.

We accept many genres, but (as you can see in our profile) we are looking for music that falls in the category of Christian music. We are a Christian publisher and we promote Christian music / Christian artists to our audience. Key in all the songs that we promote is that it is focussed on God / the gospel of Jesus Christ / a Christian way of living.

You're singing about a Highly Evolved Being coming from very far and about to discover the unknown world of Earth, and this is doesn't match the God that we believe in. I do believe that your music deserves a much larger audience than you currently have. I just don't have the channel / audience to support you with this.

I wish you all the best with finding new channels to reach more listeners.

Personally I am a fan of Heavy Metal and Progressive Metal and I found both the song  Horseman and the entire EP Burning Paradise great materials.
Talking specifically about the song Horseman when I heard it for the first time I thought that the 8 minutes could have more details and that it seemed a little too monotonous, but when listening more times paying more attention I thought that the sound can hold the 8 minutes without great problems.
About the production I thought it was very consistent with the style and that in general it is a good sound experience. Still, it should be noted that the drums are a little behind the vocal, guitar and bass, both in terms of complexity as well as in the choice of cymbals and to some extent the presence in relation to the other instruments. Something more specific to this song, since the rest of the EP the drums are much more complete.
As a suggestion of what I think would fit for next material is to experiment with guttural or some stronger drive on the vocal, even though the vocal is perfect on this album I think that changes in the voice combine with style and give more variety within the songs. Another suggestion is also to experiment with more atmospheric moments such as the introduction, which has one of the best instruments on the EP. One last suggestion is to put the lyrics in some way for first-time listeners, both to understand the themes of the songs and also as a way of engaging with the band.

Hi Mag, thanks for submitting your song to us.

First of all, we want to congratulate you for writing and singing about this serious issue many young people face. With music, we can sometimes make people understand other's pain and we think this is exactly what "Tears in The Sea" will do to people who are struggling with this right now.

That being said, we must now be a bit annoying in our feedback because there were some things in the track and the video that really got our attention in a negative way.

The production is definitely not the best, it sounds very homemade. The song itself is monotonous, it's a piano, your vocals and sometimes a guitar comes on to bring something different to it. It doesn't mean it is a bad song, definitely not, it's just that it gets boring to be listen for almost 5 minutes long. If the song was a little shorter, this wouldn't be a problem at all.

Another thing we noticed is that though the song is in english, the whatsapp messages are in french, and we couldn't really understand what was going on with the girl. We get it, you live in France, but if you meant to reach people overseas, it would be nice if you considered modifying those messages to an english version, even to match the song's language.

 There were no school scenes representing the bullying she was suffering from other people, we think the story could be better told.

The video is also very shocking, and maybe you should put on a trigger warning at its beggining.

That's all. We wish you success in your journey and carreer <3
Hi how are you? Thank u so much for sending your music for us! Unfortunately is not exactly what our main audience usually seeks on our blog, sorry for this. All the best and good luck!

Bonjour Mag,
Votre chanson n'est pas facile √† programmer en radio vue ses caract√©ristiques,  pourtant j'ai envie de tenter l'exp√©rience car elle m'a touch√©e d√®s la premi√®re √©coute et j'ai envie de partager ce sentiment avec nos auditeurs et de faire conna√Ætre votre voix, si singuli√®re et rare dans le repertuar actuel.
Je reviendrai vers vous tr√®s rapidement pour vous communiquer les modalit√©s de diffusion sur notre antenne. 
Cordialement, 
Jacques

Hello Mag!

Thanks so much for requesting us to review your track. Wow, your vocals are divine! Paired with the dramatic piano in the background, it really pronounces your voice and it just sounds so lovely. It's always so nice to receive tracks from around the globe with such different identities, moods, and genres. Every time we get surprised and learn new things from a variety of artists. First of all, the narrative behind the tracks concerning child harassment in schools is something urgent and we must talk about it, so it pleases me so much that you were able to include that in your artistic project. 

The tune is melancholic and talks about a very harsh subject, but it also does that with beauty and honesty. That is noticeable not only by the lyrics and the video but also how the instrumentation was arranged, the mood that permeates the song, and the atmosphere that's built throughout the whole song. 

Congratulation on your work and keep going! Cheers from Brazil!

Hello Eric,

You have great music, however, it's not really into our world; as described in our profile, we don't really work with jazz and related strands, we usually tend to direct our content to heavier rock, electronic... which is compatible with our bands' releases, and our followers' musical preferences.

Hi Dimitri! Thanks for your submission. 
I listened to your song very carefully and it brought back to my memory some old Mica P. Hinson's song. Very Good!

Talking about your song I'll try to be clear.

- Arrangement and Composition: the timing is perfect and is coherent with the modern standard of the Music Industry.  In 3:34 you built an effective dynamic and musical progression. 

- Production: the production is very good. The sound of bass and guitars is coherent with the Indie Folk. Maybe the drumkit is the weak point of the production. I'll explain. I think that the sound of the drums is too modern and sophisticated, closer to soft pop music than folk.

- Mix and Master: the mix is very good, smooth and clear. Your voices have a very cool dimension in the stereophonic panorama. The reverb on vocals is very deep and pleasant. Maybe the reverb on guitars and on the solo is too much. It moves back the guitars. Try to reduce the amount of the reverb on these tracks.  
Maybe the drumkit may sound closer.

I hope you enjoy my point of view.
I LOVE THIS SONG!

Hello!

"Cinnamon Hitler" is a very strong rock track with some bits of irony on it, something I absolutely love!

I liked the vocals so much (reminded me of Danzig) and the lyrics are absolutely amazing, very cleverly written. The instrumental really got me hooked from the start, the guitars, the bass and the synths are just incredibly great! Also, the guitar solo at the end was really the cherry of the cake, such a perfect way to end this amazing song. Good job, guys!

The drums are really my only caveat about the whole song, it sounds a bit off-tempo sometimes, and maybe there are too much snare rolls, but the rest is just nicely done.

The mixing and overall production is also flawless, the recording of the drums and the vocals were very nicely done, it's all sounding very clear and not a bit compressed, congratulations, guys.

I'll be happy to share this song with my team and on our Twitter, as well as add it to our playlist on Spotify so our followers can hear how incredible your work is!

Thanks for sending the track, be safe and keep on!

Hi Louis :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting Show Me How To Fall to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for¬† "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B."¬†It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB¬†
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt¬†

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to SMHtF and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
¬†
A guitar driven bedroom pop single with plenty of attention to detail on the production. Particularly attentive to that vocal performance, with the right amount of reverb and delay automation accenting where it makes it most effective. The choppy-vocal EDM-pop / dance-pop "futurebassy" drop was fun and energetic, providing contrast to the guitar-driven chilled bedroom pop of the rest of the track.

Ultimately, while it impressed us, it just didn't subvert the expectations away from "regular" commercially successful sweet bedroom pop nor dancepop/EDM pop. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on this, though.¬† ¬†

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Dear Louis Bekk,

I have to admit this is hands down one of the best vocals and instrumentations I've heard in a while !
However, there were a few things that I would have liked differently; if I may :

a) Piano was a bit too spread. I would have loved for a more centered one !
b) Mix felt a bit too muddy. I would have taken out some more low mids on it !
c) Because of the spread in the verses, chorus felt a bit too mono, which resulted in a feel of energy being lost.

With these being said, I'm really sorry I will have to pass on "Show Me How To Fall" for now.
Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success in 2021 !

Hello!

"Modern Light" is an interesting track, it combines elements of rock, synth-pop and even of some post-punk too, a very bold attempt to revive together some near-dead genres (for today standards, of course).

As a post-punk fan myself, "Modern Light" could be one of my favorite tracks of the year so far, but it has some points that bothered me a lot, at a point that compromised what I had already liked about it.

The mixing really disappointed me, it sounds too compressed and every single element of the song tries to get some room to breathe at the same time and it creates a unbelievably messy sound, and, as the song is fast paced and already noisy itself, really gets unbearable to listen to it two times in a row.

All that said, "Modern Light" is a good composition and could be certainly saved by a better production and some changes into the instrumental, but in a overall it is a good piece of music, it just needs to be put in the hands of the right producer, so all of its potential could be explored.

Thanks for sending the track, be safe and keep on!

Hi Turfu,

The music is nice, but I am a bit puzzled. I have the impression that you misunderstood our profile. I'm sorry if that is the case! 

We accept many genres, but (as you can see in our profile) we are looking for music that falls in the category of Christian music AND is in English. We are a Christian publisher and we promote Christian music / Christian artists to our audience. Key in all the songs that we promote is that it is focussed on God / the gospel of Jesus Christ / a Christian way of living.

I have issues to see your song explanation aligning to Christianity:
"...We traveled in an astral forest
Met a witch under cocktail
We exchanged our clothes
We celebrated the nouba ..."

I do believe that your music deserves a much larger audience than you currently have. I just don't have the channel / audience to support you with this.

I wish you all the best with finding new channels to reach more listeners.

Ciao Raptyle! Innanzitutto grazie per averci contattato!
Abbiamo ascoltato la tua "Sin City", un brano urban/rap di difficile "collocazione temporale".
Il beat non √® old school, ma non √® nemmeno "moderno".
I suoni scelti per comporre la strumentale, per quanto non proprio attuali, sono interessanti.
Il beat √® valido, ben strutturato, ricco di dinamica, coinvolgente.
Tu sei bravo e credibile, si sente che sei fan del genere musicale che fai, che lo hai ascoltato molto e ne hai assorbito le caratteristiche. Sei intonato ed interpreti bene le liriche che hai scritto, il tuo flow √® molto buono, ma in alcuni punti zoppichi un po'.
Ottimo l'extrabeat, paradossalmente rappato meglio di alcune parti delle strofe.
Il testo, autobiografico, √® scritto bene e ci √® piaciuto. Per nulla banale e fortunatamente non tocca quelle tematiche stupide e scontate di cui la discografia moderna √® piena.
Il vocal femminile, che dovrebbe costituire un valore aggiunto, purtroppo non ottiene quel risultato, a causa di una performance della vocalist non completamente soddisfacente sotto gli aspetti intonazione e dinamica. Peccato, il suo timbro √® piacevole.
Il mix suona discretamente, ma √® facilmente migliorabile: gli elementi sono tutti intellegibili e ben distribuiti nel panorama stereo, ma in certi punti la voce non √® ben inserita nella strumentale.
Potremmo sbagliare, ma l'impressione che abbiamo all'ascolto, √® che le voci siano state registrate su un beat stem (non multitraccia). Manca il "glue" tra beat e parti vocali.
Complessivamente "Sin City" √® un buon brano, ma per noi non del tutto convincente.
Siamo sicuri che col tempo e impegno costante, riuscirai a portare i tuoi pezzi ad un livello superiore. Continua cos√¨, sei sulla buona strada!
In bocca al lupo!

GO Staff

It's not that usual that artists share their process of composition with us here, especially when they come so naturally and through this manner, that is indeed cool. This subject you bring on your track couldn't be more contemporary of our generation and I do believe this is something urgent we need to turn our attention to. 

Now, soundwise. There is no other acceptable way to start talking about your song without saying something about your voice. It is very powerful and charged with intention, as it drives all the other elements of the song along with it. As it develops and starts to grow, it pulls everything together and reaches the song's climax very potently but with a feeling that everything is in its right place. 

Overall this sounds like a truly well-done production, all the volumes sound great, the equalization is on point, and the timbres of the instruments fit together extremely well. This kind of artistic coherence is a sign of a mature and experienced artist that already knows how to explore its language and identity in the field. We will definitely have a glance at your other tracks! Also, we are adding it to our playlist on Spotify playlist, I'll make sure to share the link with you.

Keep going, you sound gooood! Cheers from Brazil!

Money Don't Lie represents a minimalistic, soulful, in-depth bluesy rock performance with a modern twist. The verse includes some calm articulations, overwhelmed by dominant rhythmic chops and subtle guitar riffs. However, the composition transits into a much louder rock'n'roll tune during the choruses. It seems the choruses are becoming even louder and more detailed as the song progresses and, at the same time, leading into a bit of annoying repetition. The guitars demonstrate repetitious harmonizations and chord progressions, but that aspect of the song pairs with the vocal repetition. This number would sound much better if the guitar solo interrupted this repetition, but the entire song structure doesn't sound too off without guitar improvisations. It's an overall track that might sound even better with more layers of sound included along the way.

Money Don't Lie showcases how rock'n'roll, blues, rhythm, and blues articulate in such a specific manner. This composition relies upon sole minimalism during the verses but also reveals some complex instrumentations during the choruses. Repetitive guitar riffs during the chorus are liberating nearly hypnotic vibes that are forcing listeners to spin this number over and over again. The song structure is simplistic but effective for this particular genre, so Money Don't Lie shows how less is more in this case. The vocals are perhaps a bit louder than the rest of the orchestrations, but this works perfectly fine with the rest of the group. It's a great rock'n'roll composition with bits and pieces of blues included along the way. Keep up the good work.

Thanks for sharing this track to us. We like the deep, contemplative mood this gives off. It's spacious, light, and easygoing. The song explodes in reverberating atmosphere and we appreciate the laid-back, calming approach. The acoustic-led orchestration allows enough air for the lyrical clouts to float through. We however feel it comes off as rather stationary and calls for a more distinct climactic appeal. The style is reminiscent of the likes of Roo Panes, Sufjan Stevens, Bon Iver. Also you may have not noticed that clipping at 0:28 on the right field. We hope you continue to develop, explore, and hone the craft moving forward and best of luck with the release.

There were however a few things I would have really liked differently production-wise; if I may :

a) Bass was a bit low in volume, especially for a song of your genre. I would have really liked for a louder one !
b) I was not a big fan of the hihat being so panned to the left. I would have gone for a more center one, which I would have spread to give some space !
c) Last but not least, I felt also the clap could have had more body (200-400Hz), and less top. Reason being, the hihat already had these high frequencies. I would have loved a snare instead of clap for this one !

I'm really really sorry I will have to pass on "100% pure love" for now.
Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success in 2021 !

Are you only on SoundCloud or do you also have Spotify? Thanks again and have a great day! Max

Hi¬†QLAPs :)

My name is Paige, from GNH Records. Thank you so much for submitting I Wish to us to consider for our Apple Music + Spotify playlist, Futurepop. It's our home for¬† "cutting-edge pop acts who nimbly genre-blend with clever, subversive sound design, ultramodern hip-hop or pioneering alternative R&B." It has a rabid cult following which we're very proud of.

Here are the links to follow / share it:
- Spotify: urlgeni.us/spotify/NgzB¬†
- Apple Music: urlgeni.us/applemusic/7jUt¬†

I realise it's a valuable use of credits to do this here, so we've taken a very close listen to I Wish and want to provide you this constructive feedback on your submission.
¬†
The sharp attack on those synth pad stabs were really effective, providing a nice layer of synthetic sound design amongst the guitar and clicks/percussion. Your vocal here was extremely soulful, in fact the track bled into Blues more than anything. It was a wonderfully sultry listen, dripping with incredible guitar work and an easy listening atmosphere.

Ultimately, while this was enjoyable, this is much too organic and bluesy and not synthetic enough or experimental enough in the pop category for our playlist unfortunately. For Futurepop, we're consciously trying to be a real point of difference, looking for singles that push themselves into a bolder niche, taking innovative risks with more synthetic sound design or atypical arrangements, while still being grounded by very strong pop fundamentals. When you play through the first few artists we've selected for the playlist, you'll hear what we mean. We try to elevate the playlist beyond systemic commercial R&B/pop. I think you will easily find some major success with playlists and blogs that do focus on this, though.¬† ¬†

One other thing I can offer you, is a bit of an industry connection. One of our managed artists is Spectoral (@spectoral on Instagram) who co-curates the playlist with us. In fact, it lives on his artist account. So while I can't offer you a placement on the playlist, if you're an artist who is interested in creating music for the bleeding-edge, an artist who is a music addict like us, who shares our tastes, and always aspires to keep tabs on the most current sounds, then I'd strongly encourage you to DM @spectoral - on Instagram. Introduce yourself to him and send him your link. Tell him you spoke to Paige on Groover. He's real nice, a well connected producer and curator from Australia who is a true passionate new music addict himself. He's also a committee member of a not-for-profit (free) organisation called Beat Collective (beatcollective.net) that is one of the biggest artist-producer communities in the world. So he meets a LOT of artists and it's very valuable to be connected. So even if that doesn't result in you getting added to a playlist, you should still get some good value out of at least talking to him, a like-minded artist who values building good industry connections.

Go for it! :)

Paige R
GNH

Dear QLAPs,

I have to admit you have by far one of the best voices I've heard in a while. And the guitar was simply amazing !

There were however a few things I would have liked differently; if I may :

a) I felt the vocals were a bit too loud, especially for a song of your genre. I would have really liked for the vocals to have been "in" the mix instead of on "top" of it.
b) Chords were a bit too low in volume. I would have really liked them louder
c) Last but not least, I would have loved for a more controlled low end, as it felt it was messing with the compression on the master buss.

I'm really sorry I will have to pass on this gem for now.
Can't but thank you for your submission and wish you all the success in 2021 !

Carbon Chauvinist explores the vast universe of fusion jazz and bluesy progressions. These dominant elements are overwhelming the hard rock base of the group, but all three ingredients are equally present throughout the composition. The group withdraws inspiration from seventies psychedelia and hard rock but still manages to pull off some impressive contemporary jazz maneuvers. DogOn easily transcends from a reverby studio atmosphere into a more hall like ambiance with some explorations into ambient blues-rock, but also returns into the technically demanding maneuvers with ease. The group showcases exceptional musicianship in less than six minutes of pure enjoyment.

Il consiglio che ci sentiamo di darvi, viste le potenzialit√†, √® quello di cercare un qualcosa din un po' pi√π originale a livello di sound. il problema del mercato odierno √® la saturazione e aggiungere un altro artista al mercato con un sound, passami il termine, troppo conforme a ci√≤ che funziona potrebbe essere un'arma a doppio taglio.

Ciao Sokko! Innanzitutto grazie per averci contattato!
Abbiamo ascoltato la tua "QuattroVenti", una traccia decisamente particolare..
I suoni che hai scelto sono tipici del genere electro, con qualche richiamo alla dance anni '90-2000. Alcuni di essi sono accettabili, altri sono decisamente brutti ed eseguono una partitura mediocre.
Il punto di forza del tuo brano √® la ritmica. "QuattroVenti" infatti, a parte in qualche punto dove sono presenti dei flams strani, ha un bel tiro e un buon groove. Batteria e basso sono coinvolgenti ed invogliano l'ascoltatore a tenere il ritmo.
Il mix suona male: gli elementi che costituiscono il brano sono tutti intellegibili, ma alcuni suoni sono troppo alti e rovinano il balance complessivo, altri (in particolare gli hats) hanno delle frequenze alte troppo boostate, a tal punto da risultare fastidiose all'ascolto.
In generale, la tua traccia sembra una esercitazione e un composit di samples, pi√π che un brano vero e proprio. Manca un arrangiamento e di conseguenza una divisione concreta in parti.
Siamo sicuri che con il tempo ed un impegno costante, riuscirai presto a migliorare le tue produzioni.
In bocca al lupo!

GO Staff

What a incredible session! I didn't know any of your songs, but now I'm very happy to know. It's a very deanceble and interesting sonority. It's also very immersive. I didn't feel like it was three songs in a session. I consumed it like a full experience.

Congratulations again!

Best regards,

Hello ST
 
Please note that comment is my professional opinion as a music producer and audio engineer. Nothing is personal, but only direct advice and thoughts of the song's possible improvement. Also comments on what is better about the song, and also what could be better yet.

Your song "So Strange a Thing" has a good introduction with good Electronic music. The sound of the song is good to enjoy with good bass and drum instruments, which is well-played throughout the song. 

As for the singer's voice, this is a good singing female voice. The voice fits the song but has a lack with more backing vocals to fill the sound spectrum better. Hi ST! First of all, thank you for contacting us!
We listened to your "So Strange a Thing", a particular song, with various sounds, with a strong electro / house influence.
The piece is strange, between the first minute and the next part, there is a gap so evident that they seem to be 2 songs, or even 3, glued together. A particular choice, not particularly appreciated by us.
The beginning, with an arpeggiated guitar, drags the listener into a world that then turns out to be completely different from expectations, ending in a 2010 house scene, passing through an indefinite hybrid.
This is all very strange.
The vocal is crazy, the singer is in tune, has a beautiful timbre, excellent control of dynamics and remarkable vocal range. Good interpretative ability of the lyrics.
The mix sounds good, all the elements are intelligible, with the right dynamics and good distribution in the stereo landscape.
Overall your song, strange as it is, is interesting.
We advise you to focus more on your ideas and to better structure the song, which more than a real track, looks like the collage of many sessions started, never finished and stuck on each other.
You have the techniques, you know how to give life to your ideas, with time and constant commitment, we are sure that you will be able to bring your productions to a higher level, but above all concrete.
An exercise you can do is to choose a song that you particularly like, import it into your DAW, set the bpm equal to that of the imported song, put markers in order to divide the session into parts (example: verse, bridge, chorus, break , verse 2 etc.), try to copy the structure of the reference piece, then understand the changes between the parts, the variation of the sound elements, where they are present and where not etc.
Good luck!

GO Staff

Hey, ST,

Great intro! The vocal performance suits the vibe a lot. The vocal timbre sounds great! I love the rhythm of the vocal line.

In terms of mixing, the instrumental works very well. The vocal lacks presence. Try to adjust the balance between instrumental and vocal. 
The structure works well and has a clear and memorable chorus. 
All in all, a good track! Make sure to work on the mix. 

Best wishes,

What draw my attention to this song is a dominant bass sound. It goes perfectly with the post-rock aesthetics of the group. The arpeggiated chord progressions are going well with lead harmonies, and the themes are composed wisely. I adore the subtle melancholic feel that this composition leaves with these melodies. One of the best things about this number is the evolutive process that continues as the song proceeds. It seems like the layers of sound clash for dominance throughout the entire composition, without spoiling the overall listening experience. Perhaps the kick drum sounds a bit high and non-organic, in my honest opinion, but this is the only annoying thing about this number. It's an entertaining instrumental number that has a lot o potential. Well done!

Hello guys. I had to listen to the track more than once so I could truly feel  what it was about. That¬¥s not a negative comment, on the contrary, it¬¥s a song full of passages that requires focus. I don¬¥t really know if you are into video games, but I felt a Silent Hill vibe on that song. Wich is AMAZING, since I love that game. The track reminds me a lot of Akira Yamaoka¬¥s songs. I missed Mary Elizabeth McGlynn¬¥s voice though. If Silent Hill is not an inspiration, than you should listen to the OST on you favorite streaming channel, you will be surprised how close it sounds. 

That said, since I love Silent Hill¬¥s OST, I too loved "Church". My only tip is that some of the solo guitars sounds a little bit off. It¬¥s about production, mixing. I can feel it mostly from 02:07 to 02:40. That particular guitar sounds like it¬¥s not properly mixed into the song. It took my immersive experience off. I can¬¥t say for sure what¬¥s the problem to my ears, but I guess you guys should have another look at the medium frequencies there. But it¬¥s not a huge problem. As a band producer, I know for granted that when ONE person notices something on a song, a lot of other people will also notice it, even if you particularly don¬¥t. So, don¬¥t change anything if you don¬¥t want to, it will not ruins the experience of listening to this song, but maybe another opinion on that part could make it even better. 

I couldn¬¥t find this song on Spotify. Do you have it there? If you do, send me the link and I will put it on my AvA International playlist.

Aut√≥mata, hello, and thank you for sending. 

There's some cool transitions and sounds here, some good blends of texture and ramps up of noise. Post-Rock is tricky, from the masters of Mogwei to harder, more prog metal stuff, there's a balance between taking a listener with you and jolting them... a mix of progression and shock. 

I'd say the biggest thing here is the mix. All the drums have a hard and gated attack, separating them from the instruments. They 'click' when they should drive, I want to imagine this as a live recording with all the amp bleed and agro it should have. 

Ideas and track pretty good, just falters a little in presentation.

As always, that could be down to taste, but I hope maybe helpful in some way
great layering of elements - but i think the second instrumental verse could offer a bit more to show development from the start of the track

Hi guys. Firstly thank you for letting me hear your music. I really appreciate it.
Reggae (well dub actually) with an underlying hint of The Specials in there for good measure hey? 
Let's deal with the mixing and engineering as a starter. Absolutely spot on. Captures the essence of the track perfectly. Cannot fault it.
The track itself is nice - but that's about it. It's not really a full dub mix and the reggae purist will tell you it's lacking something. You're kind of falling in between everything really which as you probably understand nowadays doesn't do you any favours.
It's definitely inoffensive though. Nobody's turning it off if it came on the radio. It just doesn't stand out.
From a radio point of view (my background) it's not the sort of track I would add to the general playlist, but I would pass it on to specialist shows and let them decide. Keep sending the track to as many reggae shows as you can. I also do a Ska show and I get sent a lot of dub, reggae, new-tone etc and there's quite of this coming through right now. Jamaican based music is coming in a rush...... you heard it here first!!!
All in all I'd like to keep tabs on your music to see how it progresses and develops. If you throw some horns in there and pick up the beat a little then you will have my attention!!!
I do wish you all the best with it and hope it brings you every success. Cheers, Beefy.
